problem_names: lemma wf_Tree_wf: "wf Tree_wf"
lemma permute_Tree_tConj [simp]: "p \<bullet> tConj tset = tConj (p \<bullet> tset)"

lemma Tree_wf_eqvt_aux:
  assumes "(t1, t2) \<in> Tree_wf" shows "(p \<bullet> t1, p \<bullet> t2) \<in> Tree_wf"
lemma Tree_wf_eqvt [eqvt, simp]: "p \<bullet> Tree_wf = Tree_wf"
lemma Tree_wf_eqvt': "eqvt Tree_wf"
lemma supp_tConj [simp]: "supp (tConj tset) = supp tset"
lemma supp_tNot [simp]: "supp (tNot t) = supp t"
lemma supp_tPred [simp]: "supp (tPred f \<phi>) = supp f \<union> supp \<phi>"
lemma supp_tAct [simp]: "supp (tAct f \<alpha> t) = supp f \<union> supp \<alpha> \<union> supp t"

lemma supp_rel_eqvt [eqvt]:
  "p \<bullet> supp_rel R x = supp_rel (p \<bullet> R) (p \<bullet> x)"

lemma supp_rel_cong [fundef_cong]:
  "\<lbrakk> x=x'; \<And>a b. R ((a \<rightleftharpoons> b) \<bullet> x') x' \<longleftrightarrow> R' ((a \<rightleftharpoons> b) \<bullet> x') x' \<rbrakk> \<Longrightarrow> supp_rel R x = supp_rel R' x'"

lemma rel_bset_cong [fundef_cong]:
  "\<lbrakk> x=x'; y=y'; \<And>a b. a \<in> set_bset x' \<Longrightarrow> b \<in> set_bset y' \<Longrightarrow> R a b \<longleftrightarrow> R' a b \<rbrakk> \<Longrightarrow> rel_bset R x y \<longleftrightarrow> rel_bset R' x' y'"

lemma alpha_set_cong [fundef_cong]:
  "\<lbrakk> bs=bs'; x=x'; R (p' \<bullet> x') y' \<longleftrightarrow> R' (p' \<bullet> x') y'; f x' = f' x'; f y' = f' y'; p=p'; cs=cs'; y=y' \<rbrakk> \<Longrightarrow>
    alpha_set (bs, x) R f p (cs, y) \<longleftrightarrow> alpha_set (bs', x') R' f' p' (cs', y')"
lemma abs_Tree\<^sub>p_eq [simp]: "abs_Tree\<^sub>p (p \<bullet> t) = abs_Tree\<^sub>p t"

lemma permute_rep_abs_Tree\<^sub>p:
  obtains p where "rep_Tree\<^sub>p (abs_Tree\<^sub>p t) = p \<bullet> t"

lemma Tree_wf\<^sub>pI [simp]:
  assumes "(a, b) \<in> Tree_wf"
  shows "(abs_Tree\<^sub>p (p \<bullet> a), abs_Tree\<^sub>p b) \<in> Tree_wf\<^sub>p"

lemma Tree_wf\<^sub>p_trivialI [simp]:
  assumes "(a, b) \<in> Tree_wf"
  shows "(abs_Tree\<^sub>p a, abs_Tree\<^sub>p b) \<in> Tree_wf\<^sub>p"

lemma Tree_wf\<^sub>pE:
  assumes "(a\<^sub>p, b\<^sub>p) \<in> Tree_wf\<^sub>p"
  obtains a b where "a\<^sub>p = abs_Tree\<^sub>p a" and "b\<^sub>p = abs_Tree\<^sub>p b" and "(a,b) \<in> Tree_wf"
lemma wf_Tree_wf\<^sub>p: "wf Tree_wf\<^sub>p"

lemmas alpha_Tree_induct' = alpha_Tree.induct[case_names alpha_tConj alpha_tNot
  alpha_tPred alpha_tAct "alpha_other(1)" "alpha_other(2)" "alpha_other(3)" "alpha_other(4)"
  "alpha_other(5)" "alpha_other(6)" "alpha_other(7)" "alpha_other(8)" "alpha_other(9)"
  "alpha_other(10)" "alpha_other(11)" "alpha_other(12)" "alpha_other(13)" "alpha_other(14)"
  "alpha_other(15)" "alpha_other(16)" "alpha_other(17)" "alpha_other(18)"]

lemma alpha_Tree_induct[case_names tConj tNot tPred tAct, consumes 1]:
  assumes "t1 =\<^sub>\<alpha> t2"
  and "\<And>tset1 tset2. (\<And>a b. a \<in> set_bset tset1 \<Longrightarrow> b \<in> set_bset tset2 \<Longrightarrow> a =\<^sub>\<alpha> b \<Longrightarrow> P a b) \<Longrightarrow>
            rel_bset (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) tset1 tset2 \<Longrightarrow> P (tConj tset1) (tConj tset2)"
  and "\<And>t1 t2. t1 =\<^sub>\<alpha> t2 \<Longrightarrow> P t1 t2 \<Longrightarrow> P (tNot t1) (tNot t2)"
  and "\<And>f \<phi>. P (tPred f \<phi>) (tPred f \<phi>)"
  and "\<And>f1 \<alpha>1 t1 f2 \<alpha>2 t2. (\<And>p. p \<bullet> t1 =\<^sub>\<alpha> t2 \<Longrightarrow> P (p \<bullet> t1) t2) \<Longrightarrow> f1 = f2 \<Longrightarrow>
            (\<exists>p. (bn \<alpha>1, t1) \<approx>set (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) (supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>)) p (bn \<alpha>2, t2) \<and> (bn \<alpha>1, \<alpha>1) \<approx>set (=) supp p (bn \<alpha>2, \<alpha>2)) \<Longrightarrow>
            P (tAct f1 \<alpha>1 t1) (tAct f2 \<alpha>2 t2)"
  shows "P t1 t2"

lemma alpha_Tree_eqvt_aux:
  assumes "\<And>a b. (a \<rightleftharpoons> b) \<bullet> t =\<^sub>\<alpha> t \<longleftrightarrow> p \<bullet> (a \<rightleftharpoons> b) \<bullet> t =\<^sub>\<alpha> p \<bullet> t"
  shows "p \<bullet> supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) t = supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) (p \<bullet> t)"
lemma alpha_Tree_eqvt': "t1 =\<^sub>\<alpha> t2 \<longleftrightarrow> p \<bullet> t1 =\<^sub>\<alpha> p \<bullet> t2"
lemma alpha_Tree_eqvt [eqvt]: "t1 =\<^sub>\<alpha> t2 \<Longrightarrow> p \<bullet> t1 =\<^sub>\<alpha> p \<bullet> t2"
lemma alpha_Tree_reflp: "reflp alpha_Tree"
lemma alpha_Tree_symp: "symp alpha_Tree"
lemma alpha_Tree_transp: "transp alpha_Tree"
lemma alpha_Tree_equivp: "equivp alpha_Tree"

lemma alpha_Tree_supp_rel:
  assumes "t1 =\<^sub>\<alpha> t2"
  shows "supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) t1 = supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) t2"

lemma alpha_Tree_tAct:
  assumes "t1 =\<^sub>\<alpha> t2"
  shows "tAct f \<alpha> t1 =\<^sub>\<alpha> tAct f \<alpha> t2"
lemma supp_rel_tNot [simp]: "supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) (tNot t) = supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) t"
lemma supp_rel_tPred [simp]: "supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) (tPred f \<phi>) = supp f \<union> supp \<phi>"
lemma infinite_mono: "infinite S \<Longrightarrow> (\<And>x. x \<in> S \<Longrightarrow> x \<in> T) \<Longrightarrow> infinite T"

lemma supp_rel_tAct [simp]:
  assumes "finite (supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) t)"
  shows "supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) (tAct f \<alpha> t) = supp f \<union> (supp \<alpha> \<union> supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) t - bn \<alpha>)"
lemma Tree\<^sub>\<alpha>_abs_rep [simp]: "abs_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha> (rep_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha> t\<^sub>\<alpha>) = t\<^sub>\<alpha>"
lemma Tree\<^sub>\<alpha>_rep_abs [simp]: "rep_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha> (abs_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha> t) =\<^sub>\<alpha> t"
lemmas permute_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha>.abs_eq [eqvt, simp]
lemma alpha_Tree_permute_rep_commute [simp]: "p \<bullet> rep_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha> t\<^sub>\<alpha> =\<^sub>\<alpha> rep_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha> (p \<bullet> t\<^sub>\<alpha>)"
lemma map_bset_abs_rep_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha>: "map_bset abs_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha> (map_bset rep_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha> tset\<^sub>\<alpha>) = tset\<^sub>\<alpha>"
lemma Conj\<^sub>\<alpha>_def': "Conj\<^sub>\<alpha> tset\<^sub>\<alpha> = abs_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha> (tConj (map_bset rep_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha> tset\<^sub>\<alpha>))"
lemma Conj\<^sub>\<alpha>_eqvt [eqvt, simp]: "p \<bullet> Conj\<^sub>\<alpha> tset\<^sub>\<alpha> = Conj\<^sub>\<alpha> (p \<bullet> tset\<^sub>\<alpha>)"
lemma Not\<^sub>\<alpha>_eqvt [eqvt, simp]: "p \<bullet> Not\<^sub>\<alpha> t\<^sub>\<alpha> = Not\<^sub>\<alpha> (p \<bullet> t\<^sub>\<alpha>)"
lemma Pred\<^sub>\<alpha>_eqvt [eqvt, simp]: "p \<bullet> Pred\<^sub>\<alpha> f \<phi> = Pred\<^sub>\<alpha> (p \<bullet> f) (p \<bullet> \<phi>)"
lemma Act\<^sub>\<alpha>_eqvt [eqvt, simp]: "p \<bullet> Act\<^sub>\<alpha> f \<alpha> t\<^sub>\<alpha> = Act\<^sub>\<alpha> (p \<bullet> f) (p \<bullet> \<alpha>) (p \<bullet> t\<^sub>\<alpha>)"
lemma Conj\<^sub>\<alpha>_eq_iff [simp]: "Conj\<^sub>\<alpha> tset1\<^sub>\<alpha> = Conj\<^sub>\<alpha> tset2\<^sub>\<alpha> \<longleftrightarrow> tset1\<^sub>\<alpha> = tset2\<^sub>\<alpha>"
lemma Not\<^sub>\<alpha>_eq_iff [simp]: "Not\<^sub>\<alpha> t1\<^sub>\<alpha> = Not\<^sub>\<alpha> t2\<^sub>\<alpha> \<longleftrightarrow> t1\<^sub>\<alpha> = t2\<^sub>\<alpha>"
lemma Pred\<^sub>\<alpha>_eq_iff [simp]: "Pred\<^sub>\<alpha> f1 \<phi>1 = Pred\<^sub>\<alpha> f2 \<phi>2 \<longleftrightarrow> f1 = f2 \<and> \<phi>1 = \<phi>2"

lemma Act\<^sub>\<alpha>_eq_iff: "Act\<^sub>\<alpha> f1 \<alpha>1 t1 = Act\<^sub>\<alpha> f2 \<alpha>2 t2 \<longleftrightarrow> tAct f1 \<alpha>1 (rep_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha> t1) =\<^sub>\<alpha> tAct f2 \<alpha>2 (rep_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha> t2)"

lemma Tree\<^sub>\<alpha>_free [simp]:
  shows "Conj\<^sub>\<alpha> tset\<^sub>\<alpha> \<noteq> Not\<^sub>\<alpha> t\<^sub>\<alpha>"
  and "Conj\<^sub>\<alpha> tset\<^sub>\<alpha> \<noteq> Pred\<^sub>\<alpha> f \<phi>"
  and "Conj\<^sub>\<alpha> tset\<^sub>\<alpha> \<noteq> Act\<^sub>\<alpha> f \<alpha> t\<^sub>\<alpha>"
  and "Not\<^sub>\<alpha> t\<^sub>\<alpha> \<noteq> Pred\<^sub>\<alpha> f \<phi>"
  and "Not\<^sub>\<alpha> t1\<^sub>\<alpha> \<noteq> Act\<^sub>\<alpha> f \<alpha> t2\<^sub>\<alpha>"
  and "Pred\<^sub>\<alpha> f1 \<phi> \<noteq> Act\<^sub>\<alpha> f2 \<alpha> t\<^sub>\<alpha>"
lemma supp_alpha_supp_rel: "supp t\<^sub>\<alpha> = supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) (rep_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha> t\<^sub>\<alpha>)"
lemma supp_Conj\<^sub>\<alpha> [simp]: "supp (Conj\<^sub>\<alpha> tset\<^sub>\<alpha>) = supp tset\<^sub>\<alpha>"
lemma supp_Not\<^sub>\<alpha> [simp]: "supp (Not\<^sub>\<alpha> t\<^sub>\<alpha>) = supp t\<^sub>\<alpha>"
lemma supp_Pred\<^sub>\<alpha> [simp]: "supp (Pred\<^sub>\<alpha> f \<phi>) = supp f \<union> supp \<phi>"

lemma supp_Act\<^sub>\<alpha> [simp]:
  assumes "finite (supp t\<^sub>\<alpha>)"
  shows "supp (Act\<^sub>\<alpha> f \<alpha> t\<^sub>\<alpha>) = supp f \<union> (supp \<alpha> \<union> supp t\<^sub>\<alpha> - bn \<alpha>)"

lemma Tree\<^sub>\<alpha>_induct [case_names Conj\<^sub>\<alpha> Not\<^sub>\<alpha> Pred\<^sub>\<alpha> Act\<^sub>\<alpha> Env\<^sub>\<alpha>, induct type: Tree\<^sub>\<alpha>]:
  fixes t\<^sub>\<alpha>
  assumes "\<And>tset\<^sub>\<alpha>. (\<And>x. x \<in> set_bset tset\<^sub>\<alpha> \<Longrightarrow> P x) \<Longrightarrow> P (Conj\<^sub>\<alpha> tset\<^sub>\<alpha>)"
    and "\<And>t\<^sub>\<alpha>. P t\<^sub>\<alpha> \<Longrightarrow> P (Not\<^sub>\<alpha> t\<^sub>\<alpha>)"
    and "\<And>f pred. P (Pred\<^sub>\<alpha> f pred)"
    and "\<And>f act t\<^sub>\<alpha>. P t\<^sub>\<alpha> \<Longrightarrow> P (Act\<^sub>\<alpha> f act t\<^sub>\<alpha>)"
  shows "P t\<^sub>\<alpha>"

lemma hereditarily_fs_eqvt [eqvt]:
  assumes "hereditarily_fs t\<^sub>\<alpha>"
  shows "hereditarily_fs (p \<bullet> t\<^sub>\<alpha>)"

lemma hereditarily_fs_alpha_renaming:
  assumes "Act\<^sub>\<alpha> f \<alpha> t\<^sub>\<alpha> = Act\<^sub>\<alpha> f' \<alpha>' t\<^sub>\<alpha>'"
  shows "hereditarily_fs t\<^sub>\<alpha> \<longleftrightarrow> hereditarily_fs t\<^sub>\<alpha>'"

lemma hereditarily_fs_implies_finite_supp:
  assumes "hereditarily_fs t\<^sub>\<alpha>"
  shows "finite (supp t\<^sub>\<alpha>)"

lemma Abs_formula_inverse [simp]:
  assumes "hereditarily_fs t\<^sub>\<alpha>"
  shows "Rep_formula (Abs_formula t\<^sub>\<alpha>) = t\<^sub>\<alpha>"
lemma Rep_formula' [simp]: "hereditarily_fs (Rep_formula x)"

lemma Abs_formula_eqvt [simp]:
  assumes "hereditarily_fs t\<^sub>\<alpha>"
  shows "p \<bullet> Abs_formula t\<^sub>\<alpha> = Abs_formula (p \<bullet> t\<^sub>\<alpha>)"

lemma supp_Abs_formula [simp]:
  assumes "hereditarily_fs t\<^sub>\<alpha>"
  shows "supp (Abs_formula t\<^sub>\<alpha>) = supp t\<^sub>\<alpha>"
lemmas Rep_formula_eqvt [eqvt, simp] = permute_formula.rep_eq[symmetric]
lemma supp_Rep_formula [simp]: "supp (Rep_formula x) = supp x"
lemma supp_map_bset_Rep_formula [simp]: "supp (map_bset Rep_formula xset) = supp xset"

lemma finite_supp_implies_hereditarily_fs_Conj\<^sub>\<alpha> [simp]:
  assumes "finite (supp xset)"
  shows "hereditarily_fs (Conj\<^sub>\<alpha> (map_bset Rep_formula xset))"

lemma Conj_rep_eq:
  assumes "finite (supp xset)"
  shows "Rep_formula (Conj xset) = Conj\<^sub>\<alpha> (map_bset Rep_formula xset)"

lemma Conj_eqvt [simp]:
  assumes "finite (supp xset)"
  shows "p \<bullet> Conj xset = Conj (p \<bullet> xset)"
lemma Not_eqvt [eqvt, simp]: "p \<bullet> Not x = Not (p \<bullet> x)"
lemma Pred_eqvt [eqvt, simp]: "p \<bullet> Pred f \<phi> = Pred (p \<bullet> f) (p \<bullet> \<phi>)"
lemma Act_eqvt [eqvt, simp]: "p \<bullet> Act f \<alpha> x = Act (p \<bullet> f) (p \<bullet> \<alpha>) (p \<bullet> x)"

lemma supp_Conj [simp]:
  assumes "finite (supp xset)"
  shows "supp (Conj xset) = supp xset"
lemma supp_Not [simp]: "supp (Not x) = supp x"
lemma supp_Pred [simp]: "supp (Pred f \<phi>) = supp f \<union> supp \<phi>"
lemma supp_Act [simp]: "supp (Act f \<alpha> x) = supp f \<union> (supp \<alpha> \<union> supp x - bn \<alpha>)"

lemma Conj_eq_iff [simp]:
  assumes "finite (supp xset1)" and "finite (supp xset2)"
  shows "Conj xset1 = Conj xset2 \<longleftrightarrow> xset1 = xset2"
lemma Not_eq_iff [simp]: "Not x1 = Not x2 \<longleftrightarrow> x1 = x2"
lemma Pred_eq_iff [simp]: "Pred f1 \<phi>1 = Pred f2 \<phi>2 \<longleftrightarrow> f1 = f2 \<and> \<phi>1 = \<phi>2"
lemma Act_eq_iff: "Act f1 \<alpha>1 x1 = Act f2 \<alpha>2 x2 \<longleftrightarrow> Act\<^sub>\<alpha> f1 \<alpha>1 (Rep_formula x1) = Act\<^sub>\<alpha> f2 \<alpha>2 (Rep_formula x2)"

lemma Act_eq_iff_perm: "Act f1 \<alpha>1 x1 = Act f2 \<alpha>2 x2 \<longleftrightarrow>
  f1 = f2 \<and> (\<exists>p. supp x1 - bn \<alpha>1 = supp x2 - bn \<alpha>2 \<and> (supp x1 - bn \<alpha>1) \<sharp>* p \<and> p \<bullet> x1 = x2 \<and> supp \<alpha>1 - bn \<alpha>1 = supp \<alpha>2 - bn \<alpha>2 \<and> (supp \<alpha>1 - bn \<alpha>1) \<sharp>* p \<and> p \<bullet> \<alpha>1 = \<alpha>2)"
  (is "?l \<longleftrightarrow> ?r")

lemma Act_eq_iff_perm_renaming: "Act f1 \<alpha>1 x1 = Act f2 \<alpha>2 x2 \<longleftrightarrow>
  f1 = f2 \<and> (\<exists>p. supp x1 - bn \<alpha>1 = supp x2 - bn \<alpha>2 \<and> (supp x1 - bn \<alpha>1) \<sharp>* p \<and> p \<bullet> x1 = x2 \<and> supp \<alpha>1 - bn \<alpha>1 = supp \<alpha>2 - bn \<alpha>2 \<and> (supp \<alpha>1 - bn \<alpha>1) \<sharp>* p \<and> p \<bullet> \<alpha>1 = \<alpha>2 \<and> supp p \<subseteq> bn \<alpha>1 \<union> p \<bullet> bn \<alpha>1)"
  (is "?l \<longleftrightarrow> ?r")

lemma Tree_free [simp]:
  shows "finite (supp xset) \<Longrightarrow> Conj xset \<noteq> Not x"
  and "finite (supp xset) \<Longrightarrow> Conj xset \<noteq> Pred f \<phi>"
  and "finite (supp xset) \<Longrightarrow> Conj xset \<noteq> Act f \<alpha> x"
  and "Not x \<noteq> Pred f \<phi>"
  and "Not x1 \<noteq> Act f \<alpha> x2"
  and "Pred f1 \<phi> \<noteq> Act f2 \<alpha> x"
lemma is_FL_formula_eqvt [eqvt]: "x \<in> \<A>[F] \<Longrightarrow> p \<bullet> x \<in> \<A>[p \<bullet> F]"

text \<open>We define a permutation operation on the type of trees.\<close>

instantiation Tree :: (type, pt, pt, pt) pt
begin

primrec permute_Tree :: "perm \<Rightarrow> (_,_,_,_) Tree \<Rightarrow> (_,_,_,_) Tree" where
    "p \<bullet> (tConj tset) = tConj (map_bset (permute p) tset)"  \<comment> \<open>neat trick to get around the fact that~@{term tset} is not of permutation type yet\<close>
  | "p \<bullet> (tNot t) = tNot (p \<bullet> t)"
  | "p \<bullet> (tPred f \<phi>) = tPred (p \<bullet> f) (p \<bullet> \<phi>)"
  | "p \<bullet> (tAct f \<alpha> t) = tAct (p \<bullet> f) (p \<bullet> \<alpha>) (p \<bullet> t)"
instance

text \<open>The definition of~@{const permute} for trees gives rise to the usual notion of support. The
following lemmas, one for each constructor, describe the support of trees.\<close>
lemma supp_tConj [simp]: "supp (tConj tset) = supp tset"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. supp (tConj tset) = supp tset
unfolding supp_def

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. {a. infinite
         {b. (a \<rightleftharpoons> b) \<bullet> tConj tset \<noteq>
             tConj tset}} =
    {a. infinite
         {b. (a \<rightleftharpoons> b) \<bullet> tset \<noteq> tset}}
by simp
lemma supp_tNot [simp]: "supp (tNot t) = supp t"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. supp (tNot t) = supp t
unfolding supp_def

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. {a. infinite
         {b. (a \<rightleftharpoons> b) \<bullet> tNot t \<noteq> tNot t}} =
    {a. infinite {b. (a \<rightleftharpoons> b) \<bullet> t \<noteq> t}}
by simp
lemma supp_tPred [simp]: "supp (tPred f \<phi>) = supp f \<union> supp \<phi>"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. supp (tPred f \<phi>) = supp f \<union> supp \<phi>
unfolding supp_def

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. {a. infinite
         {b. (a \<rightleftharpoons> b) \<bullet> tPred f \<phi> \<noteq>
             tPred f \<phi>}} =
    {a. infinite
         {b. (a \<rightleftharpoons> b) \<bullet> f \<noteq> f}} \<union>
    {a. infinite
         {b. (a \<rightleftharpoons> b) \<bullet> \<phi> \<noteq> \<phi>}}
by (simp add: Collect_imp_eq Collect_neg_eq)
lemma supp_tAct [simp]: "supp (tAct f \<alpha> t) = supp f \<union> supp \<alpha> \<union> supp t"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. supp (tAct f \<alpha> t) = supp f \<union> supp \<alpha> \<union> supp t
unfolding supp_def

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. {a. infinite
         {b. (a \<rightleftharpoons> b) \<bullet> tAct f \<alpha> t \<noteq>
             tAct f \<alpha> t}} =
    {a. infinite
         {b. (a \<rightleftharpoons> b) \<bullet> f \<noteq> f}} \<union>
    {a. infinite
         {b. (a \<rightleftharpoons> b) \<bullet> \<alpha> \<noteq>
             \<alpha>}} \<union>
    {a. infinite {b. (a \<rightleftharpoons> b) \<bullet> t \<noteq> t}}
by (auto simp add: Collect_imp_eq Collect_neg_eq)
subsection \<open>Trees modulo \texorpdfstring{$\alpha$}{alpha}-equivalence\<close>

text \<open>We generalize the notion of support, which considers whether a permuted element is
\emph{equal} to itself, to arbitrary endorelations. This is available as @{const supp_rel} in
Nominal Isabelle.\<close>

lemma supp_rel_eqvt [eqvt]:
  "p \<bullet> supp_rel R x = supp_rel (p \<bullet> R) (p \<bullet> x)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. p \<bullet> supp_rel R x = supp_rel (p \<bullet> R) (p \<bullet> x)
by (simp add: supp_rel_def)

text \<open>Usually, the definition of $\alpha$-equivalence presupposes a notion of free variables.
However, the variables that are ``free'' in an infinitary conjunction are not necessarily those
that are free in one of the conjuncts. For instance, consider a conjunction over \emph{all} names.
Applying any permutation will yield the same conjunction, i.e., this conjunction has \emph{no} free
variables.

To obtain the correct notion of free variables for infinitary conjunctions, we initially defined
$\alpha$-equivalence and free variables via mutual recursion. In particular, we defined the free
variables of a conjunction as term @{term "fv_Tree (tConj tset) = supp_rel alpha_Tree (tConj tset)"}.

We then realized that it is not necessary to define the concept of ``free variables'' at all, but
the definition of $\alpha$-equivalence becomes much simpler (in particular, it is no longer mutually
recursive) if we directly use the support modulo $\alpha$-equivalence.\<close>
text \<open>The following lemmas and constructions are used to prove termination of our definition.\<close>

lemma supp_rel_cong [fundef_cong]:
  "\<lbrakk> x=x'; \<And>a b. R ((a \<rightleftharpoons> b) \<bullet> x') x' \<longleftrightarrow> R' ((a \<rightleftharpoons> b) \<bullet> x') x' \<rbrakk> \<Longrightarrow> supp_rel R x = supp_rel R' x'"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lbrakk>x = x';
     \<And>a b.
        R ((a \<rightleftharpoons> b) \<bullet> x') x' =
        R' ((a \<rightleftharpoons> b) \<bullet> x') x'\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> supp_rel R x = supp_rel R' x'
by (simp add: supp_rel_def)

lemma rel_bset_cong [fundef_cong]:
  "\<lbrakk> x=x'; y=y'; \<And>a b. a \<in> set_bset x' \<Longrightarrow> b \<in> set_bset y' \<Longrightarrow> R a b \<longleftrightarrow> R' a b \<rbrakk> \<Longrightarrow> rel_bset R x y \<longleftrightarrow> rel_bset R' x' y'"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lbrakk>x = x'; y = y';
     \<And>a b.
        \<lbrakk>a \<in> set_bset x'; b \<in> set_bset y'\<rbrakk>
        \<Longrightarrow> R a b = R' a b\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> rel_bset R x y = rel_bset R' x' y'
by (simp add: rel_bset_def rel_set_def)

lemma alpha_set_cong [fundef_cong]:
  "\<lbrakk> bs=bs'; x=x'; R (p' \<bullet> x') y' \<longleftrightarrow> R' (p' \<bullet> x') y'; f x' = f' x'; f y' = f' y'; p=p'; cs=cs'; y=y' \<rbrakk> \<Longrightarrow>
    alpha_set (bs, x) R f p (cs, y) \<longleftrightarrow> alpha_set (bs', x') R' f' p' (cs', y')"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lbrakk>bs = bs'; x = x';
     R (p' \<bullet> x') y' = R' (p' \<bullet> x') y'; f x' = f' x';
     f y' = f' y'; p = p'; cs = cs'; y = y'\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> (bs, x) \<approx>set R f p (cs, y) =
                      (bs', x') \<approx>set R' f' p' (cs', y')
by (simp add: alpha_set)

quotient_type
  ('idx,'pred,'act,'eff) Tree\<^sub>p = "('idx,'pred::pt,'act::bn,'eff::fs) Tree" / "hull_relp"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):

by (fact hull_relp_equivp)

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):

by (metis hull_relp.simps Tree\<^sub>p.abs_eq_iff)

proof (prove)

fun alpha_Tree_termination :: "('a, 'b, 'c, 'd) Tree \<times> ('a, 'b, 'c, 'd) Tree \<Rightarrow> ('a, 'b::pt, 'c::bn, 'd::fs) Tree\<^sub>p set" where
  "alpha_Tree_termination (t1, t2) = {abs_Tree\<^sub>p t1, abs_Tree\<^sub>p t2}"
text \<open>Here it comes \ldots\<close>

function (sequential)
  alpha_Tree :: "('idx,'pred::pt,'act::bn,'eff::fs) Tree \<Rightarrow> ('idx,'pred,'act,'eff) Tree \<Rightarrow> bool" (infix "=\<^sub>\<alpha>" 50) where
\<comment> \<open>@{const alpha_Tree}\<close>
  alpha_tConj: "tConj tset1 =\<^sub>\<alpha> tConj tset2 \<longleftrightarrow> rel_bset alpha_Tree tset1 tset2"
| alpha_tNot: "tNot t1 =\<^sub>\<alpha> tNot t2 \<longleftrightarrow> t1 =\<^sub>\<alpha> t2"
| alpha_tPred: "tPred f1 \<phi>1 =\<^sub>\<alpha> tPred f2 \<phi>2 \<longleftrightarrow> f1 = f2 \<and> \<phi>1 = \<phi>2"
\<comment> \<open>the action may have binding names\<close>
| alpha_tAct: "tAct f1 \<alpha>1 t1 =\<^sub>\<alpha> tAct f2 \<alpha>2 t2 \<longleftrightarrow>
    f1 = f2 \<and> (\<exists>p. (bn \<alpha>1, t1) \<approx>set alpha_Tree (supp_rel alpha_Tree) p (bn \<alpha>2, t2) \<and> (bn \<alpha>1, \<alpha>1) \<approx>set ((=)) supp p (bn \<alpha>2, \<alpha>2))"
| alpha_other: "_ =\<^sub>\<alpha> _ \<longleftrightarrow> False"
\<comment> \<open>254 subgoals (!)\<close>

proof (prove)
goal (254 subgoals):
 1. \<And>P x.
       \<lbrakk>\<And>tset1 tset2.
                   x = (tConj tset1, tConj tset2) \<Longrightarrow> P;
        \<And>t1 t2. x = (tNot t1, tNot t2) \<Longrightarrow> P;
        \<And>f1 \<phi>1 f2 \<phi>2.
           x = (tPred f1 \<phi>1, tPred f2 \<phi>2) \<Longrightarrow> P;
        \<And>f1 \<alpha>1 t1 f2 \<alpha>2 t2.
           x =
           (tAct f1 \<alpha>1 t1, tAct f2 \<alpha>2 t2) \<Longrightarrow>
           P;
        \<And>v va. x = (tNot v, tConj va) \<Longrightarrow> P;
        \<And>v va vb. x = (tNot v, tPred va vb) \<Longrightarrow> P;
        \<And>v va vb vc. x = (tNot v, tAct va vb vc) \<Longrightarrow> P;
        \<And>v va vb. x = (tPred v va, tConj vb) \<Longrightarrow> P;
        \<And>v va vb. x = (tPred v va, tNot vb) \<Longrightarrow> P;
        \<And>v va vb vc vd.
           x = (tPred v va, tAct vb vc vd) \<Longrightarrow> P;
        \<And>v va vb vc. x = (tAct v va vb, tConj vc) \<Longrightarrow> P;
        \<And>v va vb vc. x = (tAct v va vb, tNot vc) \<Longrightarrow> P;
        \<And>v va vb vc vd.
           x = (tAct v va vb, tPred vc vd) \<Longrightarrow> P;
        \<And>va v. x = (tConj va, tNot v) \<Longrightarrow> P;
        \<And>va vb v. x = (tPred va vb, tNot v) \<Longrightarrow> P;
        \<And>va vb vc v. x = (tAct va vb vc, tNot v) \<Longrightarrow> P;
        \<And>vb v va. x = (tConj vb, tPred v va) \<Longrightarrow> P;
        \<And>vb v va. x = (tNot vb, tPred v va) \<Longrightarrow> P;
        \<And>vb vc vd v va.
           x = (tAct vb vc vd, tPred v va) \<Longrightarrow> P;
        \<And>vc v va vb. x = (tConj vc, tAct v va vb) \<Longrightarrow> P;
        \<And>vc v va vb. x = (tNot vc, tAct v va vb) \<Longrightarrow> P;
        \<And>vc vd v va vb.
           x = (tPred vc vd, tAct v va vb) \<Longrightarrow> P\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> P
 2. \<And>tset1 tset2 tset1a tset2a.
       (tConj tset1, tConj tset2) =
       (tConj tset1a, tConj tset2a) \<Longrightarrow>
       rel_bset (\<lambda>x0 x1. alpha_Tree_sumC (x0, x1)) tset1 tset2 =
       rel_bset (\<lambda>x0 x1. alpha_Tree_sumC (x0, x1)) tset1a tset2a
 3. \<And>tset1 tset2 t1 t2.
       (tConj tset1, tConj tset2) = (tNot t1, tNot t2) \<Longrightarrow>
       rel_bset (\<lambda>x0 x1. alpha_Tree_sumC (x0, x1)) tset1 tset2 =
       alpha_Tree_sumC (t1, t2)
 4. \<And>tset1 tset2 f1 \<phi>1 f2 \<phi>2.
       (tConj tset1, tConj tset2) =
       (tPred f1 \<phi>1, tPred f2 \<phi>2) \<Longrightarrow>
       rel_bset (\<lambda>x0 x1. alpha_Tree_sumC (x0, x1)) tset1 tset2 =
       (f1 = f2 \<and> \<phi>1 = \<phi>2)
 5. \<And>tset1 tset2 f1 \<alpha>1 t1 f2 \<alpha>2 t2.
       (tConj tset1, tConj tset2) =
       (tAct f1 \<alpha>1 t1, tAct f2 \<alpha>2 t2) \<Longrightarrow>
       rel_bset (\<lambda>x0 x1. alpha_Tree_sumC (x0, x1)) tset1 tset2 =
       (f1 = f2 \<and>
        (\<exists>p.
            (bn \<alpha>1,
             t1) \<approx>set (\<lambda>x0 x1.
                                  alpha_Tree_sumC
                                   (x0,
                                    x1)) supp_rel
    (\<lambda>x0 x1. alpha_Tree_sumC (x0, x1)) p (bn \<alpha>2, t2) \<and>
            (bn \<alpha>1,
             \<alpha>1) \<approx>set (=) supp p (bn \<alpha>2, \<alpha>2)))
 6. \<And>tset1 tset2 v va.
       (tConj tset1, tConj tset2) = (tNot v, tConj va) \<Longrightarrow>
       rel_bset (\<lambda>x0 x1. alpha_Tree_sumC (x0, x1)) tset1 tset2 =
       False
 7. \<And>tset1 tset2 v va vb.
       (tConj tset1, tConj tset2) = (tNot v, tPred va vb) \<Longrightarrow>
       rel_bset (\<lambda>x0 x1. alpha_Tree_sumC (x0, x1)) tset1 tset2 =
       False
 8. \<And>tset1 tset2 v va vb vc.
       (tConj tset1, tConj tset2) =
       (tNot v, tAct va vb vc) \<Longrightarrow>
       rel_bset (\<lambda>x0 x1. alpha_Tree_sumC (x0, x1)) tset1 tset2 =
       False
 9. \<And>tset1 tset2 v va vb.
       (tConj tset1, tConj tset2) = (tPred v va, tConj vb) \<Longrightarrow>
       rel_bset (\<lambda>x0 x1. alpha_Tree_sumC (x0, x1)) tset1 tset2 =
       False
 10. \<And>tset1 tset2 v va vb.
        (tConj tset1, tConj tset2) = (tPred v va, tNot vb) \<Longrightarrow>
        rel_bset (\<lambda>x0 x1. alpha_Tree_sumC (x0, x1)) tset1 tset2 =
        False
A total of 254 subgoals...
by pat_completeness auto

proof (state)
this:
  wf (inv_image (max_ext Tree_wf\<^sub>p) alpha_Tree_termination)

goal (5 subgoals):
 1. \<And>tset1 tset2 a b.
       \<lbrakk>a \<in> set_bset tset1; b \<in> set_bset tset2\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> ((a, b), tConj tset1, tConj tset2)
                         \<in> inv_image (max_ext Tree_wf\<^sub>p)
                                alpha_Tree_termination
 2. \<And>t1 t2.
       ((t1, t2), tNot t1, tNot t2)
       \<in> inv_image (max_ext Tree_wf\<^sub>p) alpha_Tree_termination
 3. \<And>f1 \<alpha>1 t1 f2 \<alpha>2 t2 x.
       ((x \<bullet> t1, t2), tAct f1 \<alpha>1 t1, tAct f2 \<alpha>2 t2)
       \<in> inv_image (max_ext Tree_wf\<^sub>p) alpha_Tree_termination
 4. \<And>f1 \<alpha>1 t1 f2 \<alpha>2 t2 x a b.
       (((a \<rightleftharpoons> b) \<bullet> t1, t1), tAct f1 \<alpha>1 t1,
        tAct f2 \<alpha>2 t2)
       \<in> inv_image (max_ext Tree_wf\<^sub>p) alpha_Tree_termination
 5. \<And>f1 \<alpha>1 t1 f2 \<alpha>2 t2 x a b.
       (((a \<rightleftharpoons> b) \<bullet> t2, t2), tAct f1 \<alpha>1 t1,
        tAct f2 \<alpha>2 t2)
       \<in> inv_image (max_ext Tree_wf\<^sub>p) alpha_Tree_termination
qed (auto simp add: max_ext.simps Tree_wf.simps simp del: permute_Tree_tConj)

text \<open>We provide more descriptive case names for the automatically generated induction principle,
and specialize it to an induction rule for $\alpha$-equivalence.\<close>

lemmas alpha_Tree_induct' = alpha_Tree.induct[case_names alpha_tConj alpha_tNot
  alpha_tPred alpha_tAct "alpha_other(1)" "alpha_other(2)" "alpha_other(3)" "alpha_other(4)"
  "alpha_other(5)" "alpha_other(6)" "alpha_other(7)" "alpha_other(8)" "alpha_other(9)"
  "alpha_other(10)" "alpha_other(11)" "alpha_other(12)" "alpha_other(13)" "alpha_other(14)"
  "alpha_other(15)" "alpha_other(16)" "alpha_other(17)" "alpha_other(18)"]

lemma alpha_Tree_induct[case_names tConj tNot tPred tAct, consumes 1]:
  assumes "t1 =\<^sub>\<alpha> t2"
  and "\<And>tset1 tset2. (\<And>a b. a \<in> set_bset tset1 \<Longrightarrow> b \<in> set_bset tset2 \<Longrightarrow> a =\<^sub>\<alpha> b \<Longrightarrow> P a b) \<Longrightarrow>
            rel_bset (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) tset1 tset2 \<Longrightarrow> P (tConj tset1) (tConj tset2)"
  and "\<And>t1 t2. t1 =\<^sub>\<alpha> t2 \<Longrightarrow> P t1 t2 \<Longrightarrow> P (tNot t1) (tNot t2)"
  and "\<And>f \<phi>. P (tPred f \<phi>) (tPred f \<phi>)"
  and "\<And>f1 \<alpha>1 t1 f2 \<alpha>2 t2. (\<And>p. p \<bullet> t1 =\<^sub>\<alpha> t2 \<Longrightarrow> P (p \<bullet> t1) t2) \<Longrightarrow> f1 = f2 \<Longrightarrow>
            (\<exists>p. (bn \<alpha>1, t1) \<approx>set (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) (supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>)) p (bn \<alpha>2, t2) \<and> (bn \<alpha>1, \<alpha>1) \<approx>set (=) supp p (bn \<alpha>2, \<alpha>2)) \<Longrightarrow>
            P (tAct f1 \<alpha>1 t1) (tAct f2 \<alpha>2 t2)"
  shows "P t1 t2"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P t1 t2
using assms

proof (prove)
using this:
  t1 =\<^sub>\<alpha> t2
  \<lbrakk>\<And>a b.
              \<lbrakk>a \<in> set_bset ?tset1.0; b \<in> set_bset ?tset2.0;
               a =\<^sub>\<alpha> b\<rbrakk>
              \<Longrightarrow> P a b;
   rel_bset (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) ?tset1.0 ?tset2.0\<rbrakk>
  \<Longrightarrow> P (tConj ?tset1.0) (tConj ?tset2.0)
  \<lbrakk>?t1.0 =\<^sub>\<alpha> ?t2.0; P ?t1.0 ?t2.0\<rbrakk>
  \<Longrightarrow> P (tNot ?t1.0) (tNot ?t2.0)
  P (tPred ?f ?\<phi>) (tPred ?f ?\<phi>)
  \<lbrakk>\<And>p.
              p \<bullet> ?t1.0 =\<^sub>\<alpha> ?t2.0 \<Longrightarrow>
              P (p \<bullet> ?t1.0) ?t2.0;
   ?f1.0 = ?f2.0;
   \<exists>p.
      (bn ?\<alpha>1.0,
       ?t1.0) \<approx>set (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) supp_rel
         (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) p (bn ?\<alpha>2.0, ?t2.0) \<and>
      (bn ?\<alpha>1.0,
       ?\<alpha>1.0) \<approx>set (=) supp p (bn ?\<alpha>2.0,
        ?\<alpha>2.0)\<rbrakk>
  \<Longrightarrow> P (tAct ?f1.0 ?\<alpha>1.0 ?t1.0)
                     (tAct ?f2.0 ?\<alpha>2.0 ?t2.0)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P t1 t2
by (induction t1 t2 rule: alpha_Tree.induct) simp_all

goal (4 subgoals):
 1. \<And>tset1 tset2.
       \<lbrakk>\<And>a b.
                   \<lbrakk>a \<in> set_bset tset1; b \<in> set_bset tset2;
                    a =\<^sub>\<alpha> b\<rbrakk>
                   \<Longrightarrow> supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) a =
                                     supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) b;
        rel_bset (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) tset1 tset2\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) (tConj tset1) =
                         supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) (tConj tset2)
 2. \<And>t1 t2.
       \<lbrakk>t1 =\<^sub>\<alpha> t2;
        supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) t1 =
        supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) t2\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) (tNot t1) =
                         supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) (tNot t2)
 3. \<And>f \<phi>.
       supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) (tPred f \<phi>) =
       supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) (tPred f \<phi>)
 4. \<And>f1 \<alpha>1 t1 f2 \<alpha>2 t2.
       \<lbrakk>\<And>p.
                   p \<bullet> t1 =\<^sub>\<alpha> t2 \<Longrightarrow>
                   supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) (p \<bullet> t1) =
                   supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) t2;
        f1 = f2;
        \<exists>p.
           (bn \<alpha>1,
            t1) \<approx>set (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) supp_rel
           (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) p (bn \<alpha>2, t2) \<and>
           (bn \<alpha>1,
            \<alpha>1) \<approx>set (=) supp p (bn \<alpha>2,
          \<alpha>2)\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>)
                          (tAct f1 \<alpha>1 t1) =
                         supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) (tAct f2 \<alpha>2 t2)

text \<open>The following lemmas describe the support modulo $\alpha$-equivalence.\<close>
lemma supp_rel_tNot [simp]: "supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) (tNot t) = supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) t"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) (tNot t) = supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) t
unfolding supp_rel_def

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. {a. infinite
         {b. \<not> (a \<rightleftharpoons> b) \<bullet> tNot
                    t =\<^sub>\<alpha>
                    tNot t}} =
    {a. infinite
         {b. \<not> (a \<rightleftharpoons> b) \<bullet> t =\<^sub>\<alpha>
                    t}}
by simp
lemma supp_rel_tPred [simp]: "supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) (tPred f \<phi>) = supp f \<union> supp \<phi>"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) (tPred f \<phi>) =
    supp f \<union> supp \<phi>
unfolding supp_rel_def supp_def

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. {a. infinite
         {b. \<not> (a \<rightleftharpoons> b) \<bullet> tPred f
                    \<phi> =\<^sub>\<alpha>
                    tPred f \<phi>}} =
    {a. infinite
         {b. (a \<rightleftharpoons> b) \<bullet> f \<noteq> f}} \<union>
    {a. infinite
         {b. (a \<rightleftharpoons> b) \<bullet> \<phi> \<noteq> \<phi>}}
by (simp add: Collect_imp_eq Collect_neg_eq)

text \<open>The support modulo $\alpha$-equivalence of~@{term "tAct \<alpha> t"} is not easily described:
when~@{term t} has infinite support (modulo $\alpha$-equivalence), the support (modulo
$\alpha$-equivalence) of~@{term "tAct \<alpha> t"} may still contain names in~@{term "bn \<alpha>"}. This
incongruity is avoided when~@{term t} has finite support modulo $\alpha$-equivalence.\<close>
lemma infinite_mono: "infinite S \<Longrightarrow> (\<And>x. x \<in> S \<Longrightarrow> x \<in> T) \<Longrightarrow> infinite T"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lbrakk>infinite S;
     \<And>x. x \<in> S \<Longrightarrow> x \<in> T\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> infinite T
by (metis infinite_super subsetI)

text \<open>The abstraction function from trees to trees modulo $\alpha$-equivalence is equivariant. The
representation function is equivariant modulo $\alpha$-equivalence.\<close>

    rep_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha> (p \<bullet> t\<^sub>\<alpha>)
by (metis Tree\<^sub>\<alpha>.abs_eq_iff Tree\<^sub>\<alpha>_abs_rep permute_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha>.abs_eq)

goal (1 subgoal):

       tConj bset1 =\<^sub>\<alpha> tConj bset2
by simp
lemma map_bset_abs_rep_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha>: "map_bset abs_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha> (map_bset rep_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha> tset\<^sub>\<alpha>) = tset\<^sub>\<alpha>"

by (metis (full_types) Quotient_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha> Quotient_abs_rep bset_lifting.bset_quot_map)
lemma Conj\<^sub>\<alpha>_def': "Conj\<^sub>\<alpha> tset\<^sub>\<alpha> = abs_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha> (tConj (map_bset rep_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha> tset\<^sub>\<alpha>))"

by (metis Conj\<^sub>\<alpha>.abs_eq map_bset_abs_rep_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha>)

lemma Act\<^sub>\<alpha>_eq_iff: "Act\<^sub>\<alpha> f1 \<alpha>1 t1 = Act\<^sub>\<alpha> f2 \<alpha>2 t2 \<longleftrightarrow> tAct f1 \<alpha>1 (rep_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha> t1) =\<^sub>\<alpha> tAct f2 \<alpha>2 (rep_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha> t2)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (Act\<^sub>\<alpha> f1 \<alpha>1 t1 =
     Act\<^sub>\<alpha> f2 \<alpha>2 t2) =
    (tAct f1 \<alpha>1 (rep_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha> t1) =\<^sub>\<alpha>
     tAct f2 \<alpha>2 (rep_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha> t2))
by (metis Act\<^sub>\<alpha>.abs_eq Tree\<^sub>\<alpha>.abs_eq_iff Tree\<^sub>\<alpha>_abs_rep)
text \<open>The lifted constructors are free (except for~@{const Act\<^sub>\<alpha>}).\<close>

lemma Tree\<^sub>\<alpha>_free [simp]:
  shows "Conj\<^sub>\<alpha> tset\<^sub>\<alpha> \<noteq> Not\<^sub>\<alpha> t\<^sub>\<alpha>"
  and "Conj\<^sub>\<alpha> tset\<^sub>\<alpha> \<noteq> Pred\<^sub>\<alpha> f \<phi>"
  and "Conj\<^sub>\<alpha> tset\<^sub>\<alpha> \<noteq> Act\<^sub>\<alpha> f \<alpha> t\<^sub>\<alpha>"
  and "Not\<^sub>\<alpha> t\<^sub>\<alpha> \<noteq> Pred\<^sub>\<alpha> f \<phi>"
  and "Not\<^sub>\<alpha> t1\<^sub>\<alpha> \<noteq> Act\<^sub>\<alpha> f \<alpha> t2\<^sub>\<alpha>"
  and "Pred\<^sub>\<alpha> f1 \<phi> \<noteq> Act\<^sub>\<alpha> f2 \<alpha> t\<^sub>\<alpha>"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (Conj\<^sub>\<alpha> tset\<^sub>\<alpha> \<noteq>
     Not\<^sub>\<alpha> t\<^sub>\<alpha> &&&
     Conj\<^sub>\<alpha> tset\<^sub>\<alpha> \<noteq>
     Pred\<^sub>\<alpha> f \<phi> &&&
     Conj\<^sub>\<alpha> tset\<^sub>\<alpha> \<noteq>
     Act\<^sub>\<alpha> f \<alpha> t\<^sub>\<alpha>) &&&
    Not\<^sub>\<alpha> t\<^sub>\<alpha> \<noteq>
    Pred\<^sub>\<alpha> f \<phi> &&&
    Not\<^sub>\<alpha> t1\<^sub>\<alpha> \<noteq>
    Act\<^sub>\<alpha> f \<alpha> t2\<^sub>\<alpha> &&&
    Pred\<^sub>\<alpha> f1 \<phi> \<noteq>
    Act\<^sub>\<alpha> f2 \<alpha> t\<^sub>\<alpha>
by (simp add: Conj\<^sub>\<alpha>_def' Not\<^sub>\<alpha>_def Pred\<^sub>\<alpha>_def Act\<^sub>\<alpha>_def Tree\<^sub>\<alpha>.abs_eq_iff)+
text \<open>The following lemmas describe the support of constructed trees modulo $\alpha$-equivalence.\<close>
lemma supp_alpha_supp_rel: "supp t\<^sub>\<alpha> = supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) (rep_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha> t\<^sub>\<alpha>)"

    supp_rel (=\<^sub>\<alpha>) (rep_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha> t\<^sub>\<alpha>)
unfolding supp_def supp_rel_def

goal (1 subgoal):

             t\<^sub>\<alpha>}} =
    {a. infinite
         {b. \<not> (a \<rightleftharpoons> b) \<bullet> rep_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha>
                    t\<^sub>\<alpha> =\<^sub>\<alpha>
                    rep_Tree\<^sub>\<alpha> t\<^sub>\<alpha>}}
by (metis (mono_tags, lifting) Collect_cong Tree\<^sub>\<alpha>.abs_eq_iff Tree\<^sub>\<alpha>_abs_rep alpha_Tree_permute_rep_commute)

proof (prove)

  assumes "finite (supp t\<^sub>\<alpha>)"

    and "\<And>t\<^sub>\<alpha>. P t\<^sub>\<alpha> \<Longrightarrow> P (Not\<^sub>\<alpha> t\<^sub>\<alpha>)"
    and "\<And>f pred. P (Pred\<^sub>\<alpha> f pred)"
    and "\<And>f act t\<^sub>\<alpha>. P t\<^sub>\<alpha> \<Longrightarrow> P (Act\<^sub>\<alpha> f act t\<^sub>\<alpha>)"

text \<open>There is no (obvious) strong induction principle for trees modulo $\alpha$-equivalence: since
their support may be infinite, we may not be able to rename bound variables without also renaming
free variables.\<close>
subsection \<open>Hereditarily finitely supported trees\<close>

text \<open>We cannot obtain the type of infinitary formulas simply as the sub-type of all trees (modulo
$\alpha$-equivalence) that are finitely supported: since an infinite set of trees may be finitely
supported even though its members are not (and thus, would not be formulas), the sub-type of
\emph{all} finitely supported trees does not validate the induction principle that we desire for
formulas.

Instead, we define \emph{hereditarily} finitely supported trees. We require that environments and
state predicates are finitely supported.\<close>

inductive hereditarily_fs :: "('idx,'pred::fs,'act::bn,'eff::fs) Tree\<^sub>\<alpha> \<Rightarrow> bool" where
  Conj\<^sub>\<alpha>: "finite (supp tset\<^sub>\<alpha>) \<Longrightarrow> (\<And>t\<^sub>\<alpha>. t\<^sub>\<alpha> \<in> set_bset tset\<^sub>\<alpha> \<Longrightarrow> hereditarily_fs t\<^sub>\<alpha>) \<Longrightarrow> hereditarily_fs (Conj\<^sub>\<alpha> tset\<^sub>\<alpha>)"
| Not\<^sub>\<alpha>: "hereditarily_fs t\<^sub>\<alpha> \<Longrightarrow> hereditarily_fs (Not\<^sub>\<alpha> t\<^sub>\<alpha>)"
| Pred\<^sub>\<alpha>: "hereditarily_fs (Pred\<^sub>\<alpha> f \<phi>)"
| Act\<^sub>\<alpha>: "hereditarily_fs t\<^sub>\<alpha> \<Longrightarrow> hereditarily_fs (Act\<^sub>\<alpha> f \<alpha> t\<^sub>\<alpha>)"
text \<open>@{const hereditarily_fs} is equivariant.\<close>

by (metis hereditarily_fs.Pred\<^sub>\<alpha> mem_Collect_eq)

subsection \<open>Constructors for infinitary formulas\<close>

text \<open>We lift the constructors for trees (modulo $\alpha$-equivalence) to infinitary formulas.
Since~@{const Conj\<^sub>\<alpha>} does not necessarily yield a (hereditarily) finitely supported tree when
applied to a (potentially infinite) set of (hereditarily) finitely supported trees, we cannot use
Isabelle's {\bf lift\_definition} to define~@{term Conj}. Instead, theorems about terms of the
form~@{term "Conj xset"} will usually carry an assumption that~@{term xset} is finitely supported.\<close>

definition Conj :: "('idx,'pred,'act,'eff) formula set['idx] \<Rightarrow> ('idx,'pred::fs,'act::bn,'eff::fs) formula" where
  "Conj xset = Abs_formula (Conj\<^sub>\<alpha> (map_bset Rep_formula xset))"

  assumes "finite (supp xset1)" and "finite (supp xset2)"
  shows "Conj xset1 = Conj xset2 \<longleftrightarrow> xset1 = xset2"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):

using assms

by (metis (erased, hide_lams) Conj\<^sub>\<alpha>_eq_iff Conj_rep_eq Rep_formula_inverse injI inj_eq bset.inj_map)

by (metis Not.rep_eq Not\<^sub>\<alpha>_eq_iff Rep_formula_inverse)

text \<open>Helpful lemmas for dealing with equalities involving~@{const Act}.\<close>

lemma Act_eq_iff_perm: "Act f1 \<alpha>1 x1 = Act f2 \<alpha>2 x2 \<longleftrightarrow>
  f1 = f2 \<and> (\<exists>p. supp x1 - bn \<alpha>1 = supp x2 - bn \<alpha>2 \<and> (supp x1 - bn \<alpha>1) \<sharp>* p \<and> p \<bullet> x1 = x2 \<and> supp \<alpha>1 - bn \<alpha>1 = supp \<alpha>2 - bn \<alpha>2 \<and> (supp \<alpha>1 - bn \<alpha>1) \<sharp>* p \<and> p \<bullet> \<alpha>1 = \<alpha>2)"
  (is "?l \<longleftrightarrow> ?r")

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (Act f1 \<alpha>1 x1 = Act f2 \<alpha>2 x2) =
    (f1 = f2 \<and>
     (\<exists>p.
         supp x1 - bn \<alpha>1 = supp x2 - bn \<alpha>2 \<and>
         (supp x1 - bn \<alpha>1) \<sharp>* p \<and>
         p \<bullet> x1 = x2 \<and>
         supp \<alpha>1 - bn \<alpha>1 =
         supp \<alpha>2 - bn \<alpha>2 \<and>
         (supp \<alpha>1 - bn \<alpha>1) \<sharp>* p \<and>
         p \<bullet> \<alpha>1 = \<alpha>2))
proof

proof (state)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. Act f1 \<alpha>1 x1 = Act f2 \<alpha>2 x2 \<Longrightarrow>
    f1 = f2 \<and>
    (\<exists>p.
        supp x1 - bn \<alpha>1 = supp x2 - bn \<alpha>2 \<and>
        (supp x1 - bn \<alpha>1) \<sharp>* p \<and>
        p \<bullet> x1 = x2 \<and>
        supp \<alpha>1 - bn \<alpha>1 = supp \<alpha>2 - bn \<alpha>2 \<and>
        (supp \<alpha>1 - bn \<alpha>1) \<sharp>* p \<and>
        p \<bullet> \<alpha>1 = \<alpha>2)
 2. f1 = f2 \<and>

subsection \<open>\texorpdfstring{$F/L$}{F/L}-formulas\<close>

context effect_nominal_ts
begin

text \<open>The predicate~@{term is_FL_formula} will characterise exactly those formulas in a particular
set~$A^{F/L}$.\<close>

inductive is_FL_formula :: "'effect first \<Rightarrow> ('idx,'pred,'act,'effect) formula \<Rightarrow> bool"
where
  Conj: "finite (supp xset) \<Longrightarrow> (\<And>x. x \<in> set_bset xset \<Longrightarrow> is_FL_formula F x) \<Longrightarrow> is_FL_formula F (Conj xset)"
| Not:  "is_FL_formula F x \<Longrightarrow> is_FL_formula F (Not x)"
| Pred: "f \<in>\<^sub>f\<^sub>s F \<Longrightarrow> is_FL_formula F (Pred f \<phi>)"
| Act:  "f \<in>\<^sub>f\<^sub>s F \<Longrightarrow> bn \<alpha> \<sharp>* (F,f) \<Longrightarrow> is_FL_formula (L (\<alpha>,F,f)) x \<Longrightarrow> is_FL_formula F (Act f \<alpha> x)"

abbreviation in_\<A> :: "('idx,'pred,'act,'effect) formula \<Rightarrow> 'effect first \<Rightarrow> bool"
  ("_ \<in> \<A>[_]" [51,0] 50) where
  "x \<in> \<A>[F] \<equiv> is_FL_formula F x"
declare is_FL_formula.induct [case_names Conj Not Pred Act, induct type: formula]
lemma is_FL_formula_eqvt [eqvt]: "x \<in> \<A>[F] \<Longrightarrow> p \<bullet> x \<in> \<A>[p \<bullet> F]"

           x \<in> set_bset xset \<Longrightarrow>
           p \<bullet> x \<in> \<A>[p \<bullet> F]\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> p \<bullet> Conj xset \<in> \<A>[p \<bullet> F]
 2. \<And>F x.
       \<lbrakk>x \<in> \<A>[F];
        p \<bullet> x \<in> \<A>[p \<bullet> F]\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> p \<bullet> FL_Formula.Not
x \<in> \<A>[p \<bullet> F]

       f \<in>\<^sub>f\<^sub>s F \<Longrightarrow>
       p \<bullet> Pred f \<phi> \<in> \<A>[p \<bullet> F]
 4. \<And>f F \<alpha> x.
       \<lbrakk>f \<in>\<^sub>f\<^sub>s F; bn \<alpha> \<sharp>* (F, f);
        x \<in> \<A>[L (\<alpha>, F, f)];
        p \<bullet> x \<in> \<A>[p \<bullet> L (\<alpha>, F, f)]\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> p \<bullet> Act f \<alpha>
